彼らは急き立てないと働かぬ
They will not work unless they are urged to do so―unless they are pressed to do so.

content:
せきにん〔責任〕
〈名〉
1. Responsibility; answerability; accountability:(債務の責任)liability:(義務の責任)duty; obligation:(重任の責任)trust:(非難の責任)blame:(立証の責任)burden of proof

content.content: 僕は責任がある
I am responsible―answerable―accountable.
何の責任がある
to be responsible for something
会計は預った金の責任がある
The treasurer is responsible for the money placed in his charge.
誰に対して何の責任がある
to be responsible to some one for something
雇人は雇主に対して託された仕事の責任がある
The employ? is responsible to his employer for the work placed in his hands.
責任内閣は議会に対して施政の責任がある
A responsible cabinet is responsible to the Diet for the conduct of affairs.
人は神に対して行動の責任がある
Man is responsible to God for his conduct.
保証人は本人の負債を払う責任がある
The surety is liable for the debt of the principal.
これは誰の責任か
Who is responsible for it?―Who is to blame for it?
今度の成功は僕の責任だ
I am responsible for the success.
この失敗は君の責任だ
You are to blame for the failure.
責任は君にある
The responsibility lies with you.
立証の責任は原告にあり
The burden of proof lies with the accuser.
水先が乗り込んでいたから船長には責任が無い
As there was a pilot on board, the captain is absolved of all blame.
責任は僕の双肩にかかっている
The responsibility rests upon my shoulders.
彼らを改心させるのは僕の責任だ
It lies upon me―It is incumbent upon me―to reclaim them.

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 責任を負う
to bear the responsibility―shoulder the responsibility―assume the responsibility―accept the responsibility
それは僕が責任を負う
I will answer for it―be responsible for it―hold myself responsible for it.
後はどうなろうと僕が責任を負う
I will answer for the consequences.
自分でしたことは自分で責任を負わねばならぬ(自業自得)
One must take the consequences of one's own deed.
(フランスに鉄道椿事の少ないのは)椿事があると誰かしらその責任を負わねばならない(からだ)
Where there is a disaster, somebody or other must hang for it.
君に責任を負わせる
I will hold you responsible―You shall answer for it.
今度成功することは責任を負って保証する(間違ったら腹を切る)
I will answer for success (with my life).
責任を負って物品を買う(損をしたら俺が背負う)
I will buy the goods at my own risk.
責任を負ってやれ
Do it at your risk!―at your peril!
(人から用を頼まれて)よし責任を負うて引受けた
I will see to it―see about it.
責任を負ってさせます
I will see it done.
責任を負って仕事をさせます
I will see that he does the work―I will see that the work is done―I will see the work done.
責任を負って彼に金を返済させます
I will see that he pays you―I will see that you are paid―I will see you paid.
僕は責任を感ぜざるを得ぬ
I can not but feel the responsibility.
彼は責任を重んずる
He has a deep sense of responsibility―He is true to his trust.
責任を重んじて職に殉した
True to his trust. he died at his post.
責任が重い
It is a heavy responsibility―a weighty duty―an important trust.
英語の先生は責任重しと言うべし
The English teacher has an important trust placed in his hands.
責任の重い地位
a responsible post―a position of trust
責任を尽す、責任を果たす
to acquit oneself of one's responsibility―discharge one's duty
責任をふさぐ
to get through one's duty (in a perfunctory manner)
それで責任が済むと思うか
Do you think you have done your duty?
責任をのがれる、責任を回避する
to shirk one's responsibility―shift off one's responsibility―shuffle off a responsibility
人に責任を転嫁する(おっかぶせる)
to shuffle off one's responsibility on another's shoulders―shift one's responsibility on another's shoulders
責任を問う
to call one to account
当局者の責任を問うべきである
The authorities concerned ought to be called to account.
責任を解除する
to release one from one's responsibility―relieve one of one's responsibility―acquit one of one's responsibility

content.content: 彼は少しのことで赤面する
He will blush on the least provocation―He is very modest.
恥じて赤面した
I blushed for shame.
彼女はポッと赤面した
A blush passed over her face.
これは実に赤面の至りです
I must blush for shame―I am ashamed of myself.
君にそうされては赤面の至りだ
You put me to the blush―put me to shame.
そうお賞めに与っては赤面の至りです
Spare my blushes!
あの人はすぐに赤面する
He is very modest.
そのように賞められては赤面せずに聞いておれぬ
I am too modest to listen to such praises.
語学では男が小娘に赤面させられることがある
In languages, a girl of fifteen might put you to the blush.

あれは赤裸々にものを言う人だ

赤痢にかかっている者(赤痢患者)がたくさんある
There are many cases of dysentery.

Some people die of dysentery―Some cases of dysentery prove fatal.

content.content: せかれて募る恋の情
“A fence between makes love more keen.”

content:
せく〔急く〕
〈自動〉(=急ぐ)to hurry; to make haste; to be flurried; to be impatient

content.content: そう急くな
Don't be in such a hurry!
君はあまり急くから何事もできないのだ
You are too impatient to succeed in anything.
気が急いてじっとしていられぬ
I feel so flurried that I can not sit still.
急いては事を仕損じる
“Haste makes waste.”
急き来る涙を押し止め
I checked my rising tears.

content: 〈他動〉(=急き立てる)to hurry (one); to urge, press (one to do something)

content.content: 我々は急かれて汽車に乗った
We were hurried into the train.
彼らは急かれないと働かない
They will not work unless they are urged to do so―pressed to do so.

content:
せけん〔世間〕
〈名〉The public; the world; the town; society; life; people:(=の) other:(=に) in the world; abroad

content.content: 世間を見る
to see the world―see the ways of the world
彼はなかなか世間を見ている
He has seen much of life.
世間を見た人(世間通)だ
He is a man of the world.
世間を見ない(世間見ずだ)
He has seen nothing of life―seen little of the world―He is ignorant of the world.
世間を知っている(世事に通じている)
He knows the world―He has a knowledge of the world―He is in touch with the world.
世間を知らぬ(世事に疎い)
He is ignorant of the world―He is out of touch with the world.
生まれたての赤ん坊のように世間を知らぬ
He knows the world as little as a baby.
世間知らずの高枕
He sleeps in peace in happy ignorance of the world―He reposes in the lap of ignorance.
彼は世間に明るい
He is versed in the ways of the world.
世間に明るくなる
to become versed in the ways of the world―cut one's eye-teeth
世間に暗い
He is ignorant of the world.
彼は世間の事情に通じている
He is versed in worldly affairs―in touch with the world.
彼は久しく引込んでいるから世間の事情に疎くなっている
He has led a retired life so long that he is out of touch with the world.
彼は世間の信用がある
He has credit with the public―He stands high in the public estimation.
相応に世間の信用ある商人だ
He is a respectable tradesman.
世間ではそう言っている
People say so.
世間では彼を発狂人だと言っている
People say that he is mad.
世間の噂ではその人はまだ生きているそうだ
Rumour says―Rumour has it―that the man is still living.
その事件が世間の噂になった
The affair got abroad―got wind―took air.
彼は世間の評判(世の談柄)になっている
He is the talk of the town.
世間では寄ると触るとその話で持ちきっている
People talk of nothing else.
彼は世間の評判ほど偉くない
He is not so great a man as he is reputed to be.
世間の評判ほど悪い人間じゃない
He is not so bad a man as he is reported to be―no so black as he is painted. (“The devil is not so black as he is painted”―悪魔は評判ほどの悪ならず―なる諺より)
世間の口がうるさい(人の口に戸が立てられぬ)
People will talk―What will the world say?―What will Mrs. Grundy say?
世間をはばかること
Grundyism
本分さえ尽くしておけば世間にはばかるところは無い
If I do my duty, I can look the world in the face.
世間がやかましい
The world is censorious.
そんなことをすると世間が許さぬ(世の非難を招く)
If you do such a thing, you will lay yourself open to public censure―(他動詞構文にすれば) Such conduct will lay you open to public censure.
世間は世間さ
“Let the world wag!”―“Let people talk and dogs bark.”
遊んでいては世間様に済まない
Idleness is a sin against the world.
世間が静かだ
All is silent―All is quiet.
世間は寝静まっている
The town is at rest.
世間が騒がしい
People are alarmed―The town is in an uproar.
この疑獄が世間を騒がした
The scandal created a sensation―made a stir in town.
世間が物騒だ
Burglary is rife.
世間になにか面白いことはありませんか
Is there any news?―How wags the world?
世間にはなにも面白いことは無いようだ
There is no news stirring.
近頃は忙しくて世間のことはちっとも知らない
I have been so busy that I don't know what is going on in the world.
世間にはよくあることだが二人はとうとうくっついてしまった
As often happens,―As is often the case,―they at last jumped the broomstick.
世間にはそんな人はいくらもある
There are many such people abroad―in the world.
世間の娘はお雛飾りをしている年頃に彼女はひとかどの政治家であった
She was an able politician at an age when other girls are dressing dolls.
世間へ出る
to go out into the world―start in life
世間へ出るとそんなうかつなことではいかん
You must have all your wits about you when you go out into the world.
世間へ出ると学校で覚えたことは役に立たぬ
What you learn at school, is useless in life.
めでたく世間へ出る
to make a good start in life―start in life under fair auspices
世間へ出て人にもまれる
to be buffeted by the world―knocked about in the world
世間にもまれなけりゃ人間に成れぬ
The world will make a man of you.
あのような人間を世間に出すのは市に虎を放つようなものだ
It is dangerous to let loose such men on society.
彼はあんなことをしたから世間に顔出しもできない
After such conduct on his part, he can not show his face in society.
世間を渡る
to walk through life―(方々なら)―knock about the world
渡る世間に鬼は無い
Man is man everywhere.
世間は広い
The world is wide―(ここばかり日は照らぬの意味なら)―I have all the world before me.
(食い詰めて)広い世間を狭くする
to lose credit with everybody
世間は広いようで狭い
The world is not so wide as it seems―One may lose credit with everybody.
彼らは世間を瞞着する奴らだ
Those men impose upon the public.
世間の同情を得る
to win public sympathy
彼は不幸に逢ってかえって世間の同情を得た
His misfortune won him public sympathy.
君は世間に誤解されている
You are misunderstood by the world.
僕は君の行動について世間の誤解を解くようにしよう
I will set your conduct in a proper light―set you right with the world.
その頃は普選が世間の問題になっていた
Universal suffrage was then at the front―in the air.
世間を張る
to make an appearance
世間の義理
conventional propriety―shackles of convention―demands of custom
(飽きも飽かれもせぬ仲を)世間の義理ゆえ遠ざかる

content:
せけんてい〔世間体〕
〈名〉Appearance; decency; decorum; conventional propriety

content.content: 世間体ということがある
We must have regard to appearance―Regard must be had to appearance.
彼は世間体などはさらにかまわぬ
He has no regard to appearance.
世間体が好い
decent―decorous―respectable
世間体が悪い
indecent―indecorous―not respectable

It would be indecent for her to marry again before one year of her windowhood is out.

世間体の好いことを言っている
He says decorous things―He talks decorum.

He says such things to save appearances―for decency's sake.

英語の先生としては世間並みだ

He is above the generality of English teachers―above the common run of English teachers.
先生としては世間並み以下だ
He is below the generality of teachers―below the common run of teachers.
彼は世間並みに言えば善い人だ
He is a good man, as the world goes―as men go.
世間並みに言えば良い先生だ
He is a good teacher, as the world goes―as teachers go.
世間並みにする
to follow the world

遅くまで世間話をした

話が世間話になった

content: 2. (=意見) an opinion; a view

content.content: 説を懐く
to entertain an opinion―hold an opinion
説を立てる

to give an opinion―deliver (oneself of) an opinion―advance an opinion―voice an opinion―set forth one's views―air one's views

content.content: 彼がせっかく勉強したのに失敗したのは気の毒だ

content.content: せっかくまとまりかかった相談が破談になってしまった

content: 2. (=しきりに)eagerly; earnestly:(=の) earnest; pressing

content.content: せっかくのお志だから頂戴致します

せっかくのお勧めだからやってみましょう
Since you are so earnest in your recommendation, I will make a trial.

content: 3. (=ご親切に)kindly:(=の) kind

content.content: 経費を節約しなければならぬ

to practise economy

content.content: 彼の不心得を説諭した
I reasoned with him on his mistake.
彼に懇々説諭した
I talked seriously to him―I earnestly reasoned with him on his mistake.
説諭して納得さした

説諭して懸念を懐かしめないようにした
I reasoned her out of her fears.
説諭して聞かなければ強制的にさせるよりほかは無い
If persuasion fails, we must resort to force.
彼は警察で説諭して返された

content.content: 今が大事の瀬戸際だ
This is a most critical moment.
身が立つか立たぬかの瀬戸際だ
It is a moment which must decide whether I shall stand or fall.

content.content: 瀬戸物を焼く
to bake pottery―fire pottery
瀬戸物が一つも無い
There is not a piece of crockery―not a piece of pottery.

content.content: 人の背中を叩く
to slap one on the back
背中に灸をすえる
to cauterize the back with moxa
背中から水を浴びせられるような気がした
It sent a chill down my back.

content.content: 背中合わせに寝よう
Let us lie back to back!

content: 2. (=不和)at variance

content.content: 二人は背中合わせだ
They are at variance―at odds―with each other.

content:
ぜに〔銭〕
〈名〉A small coin; a penny; cash(は単複数共); money(は複数無し)

content.content: 働いて銭を取る
to earn money―turn an honest penny
銭ある時は鬼も使う
“Money makes the mare to go.”
何をするにも銭が要る
Everything costs money.
あの人はいつも銭が無い
He is always impecunious.
銭の表、銭の裏
head―tail

ぜにあおい〔銭葵〕
〈名〉The mallows

ぜにいれ〔銭入れ〕

content:

content.content: 銭金で買われない物もある
Money can not buy all things.
銭金は親子も他人
“Business is business.”
銭金で済むことなら多少は出してもよい
If money will do the business, I am willing to give some.
銭金は涌きもの
Money comes to those who work.

ぜにがめ〔銭亀〕
〈名〉A small kind of tortoise

content:

content.content: あの男は銭勘定ばかりしている
He is always thinking how to make money.

1. A till
2. (=銭を取る人)a milch cow

content:

content.content: 銭離れが好い
He is free with his money―generous with his money―liberal of his money―open-handed.
銭離れが悪い
He is close-fisted―stingy―a miser.

to narrow one's sphere of influence

to humiliate oneself

content:
ぜひ〔是非〕
〈名〉
1. Right and wrong; right or wrong; propriety

content.content: 是非の心は智の端なり
The sense of right and wrong is the beginning of wisdom.
是非を弁ずる
to distinguish between right and wrong―know right from wrong
人の行為の是非を論ずる、是非を問う
to question the propriety of one's action―call one's action in question
是非を論ぜず彼は意見を通す
Whether right or wrong, he carries his point.
是非を天下に問わん
Let us appeal to the public!―Let the public judge between us!
それは是非も無いことだ、是非に及ばぬ(しかたがない)
It can not be helped―There is no help for it.
待てとあれば是非に及ばぬ
If I must wait, there is no help for it.
不承知とあれば是非も無し
If you will not consent, there is no help for it―If you will agree, well and good.
是非にとあれば是非も無し
If you must, why, you must.
それは是非無いことだ
It is necessary―unavoidable―inevitable.
人の死ぬのは是非無いことだ
Death is inevitable.
是非無く
of necessity―needs―perforce
金が無いから是非無く止める
I must of necessity give it up―I must needs give it up―I am obliged to give it up―I must give it up―for want of money.
二人は是非無く別れた
They had of necessity to separate―They were obliged to separate―They had to separate.

content: 〈副〉Of necessity; needs; perforce; positively; absolutely; particularly; badly; without fail; by all means

content.content: ぜひそうでなければならぬ
It must of necessity be so―It must needs be so―It must be so.
この金がぜひ無ければならぬ
It is absolutely necessary that I should have the money―I must needs the money―I need the money badly.
ぜひそのわけを聞かねばならぬ
I must positively know your reason―I must know your reason―I insist on knowing your reason.
彼はぜひその手紙を見せろと言ってきかなかたった
He insisted on seeing the letter.
家の主人がぜひ泊って行けと言ってきかなかった
The master of the house insisted on my staying for the night.
ぜひと仰有るなら何とも申しません
If you will have it so,―If you insist upon it,―I have nothing to say against it.
ぜひ留まれと仰有るなら留まりもしましょう
If you will have me stay,―If you insist on my staying,―I shall stay.
今度はぜひとも成功する
I must positively succeed this time―I am bound to succeed this time.
気が済まないからぜひ取って下さい
I must insist upon your taking the money.
ぜひ金を取ってくれと言って迫った
I pressed the money upon him.
ぜひ伺います
I shall call on you without fail―I will not fail to call on you―I will be sure to call on you.
こちらの方へおいでの節はぜひお立ち寄り下さい
If you ever come up this way, do not fail to look in!―be sure to look in!
ぜひ来給え
Do not fail to come!―Be sure to come!―Do come!
奈良へ行ったらぜひ博物館へ行ってみ給え
If you ever go to Nara, do not fail to visit the museum there.
ぜひお供がしたい
I must go with you―You must take me there.
ぜひ会いたい
I wish to see him particularly―I am dying to see him.
ぜひやってみたい
I am eager to try―mad to try.
そういうわけだからぜひお待ちを願いたい
Such being the case, I must request you wait.
ラテン語がやりたいならぜひおやりなさい
If you with to study Latin, study it by all means!
ぜひそうなさい
Do so by all means!
かえってご迷惑でしょうがぜひおいで下さい(否とは言わさぬ)
I will take no denial.
男の付き合いはぜひこうありたいものだ
I like this sort of thing between man and man.

content:
ぜひなく〔是非無く〕
〈副〉Of necessity; needs; perforce

content.content: 金が無いから是非無く止める
I must of necessity give it up―I must needs give it up―I must give it up―I am obliged to give it up―for want of money.
二人は是非無く別れた

content:
せひょう〔世評〕

content.content: 彼は発狂だという世評だ
He is reported to be mad.
世評の通りだ
It is as people say.
彼は世評に上がっている
He is the talk of the town.
この問題については世評は区々である
Public opinion is divided on the question.
彼は世評に頓着せぬ
He is indifferent to praise or censure.

content:

content.content: この子はお父さんをせびって何でも欲しい物を買って貰う
She will tease her papa out of anything she wants.

1. (=かちわたりして深さを試す)to try the depth by wading
2. (=試みにやってみる)to make a trial
3. (=人気を見る)to fly a kite
4. (=試みに当たってみる)to sound one's views; to feel one's pulse; to throw out a feeler

content:
せまい〔狭い〕
〈形〉Narrow (street); strait (gate); small (house); tight (coat); limited (range); (to be) pinched for room, cramped for room, confined for space

content.content: 幅が狭い
to be narrow
京都は町幅が狭い
Kyoto has narrow streets.
道幅が狭くて自動車が通れぬ
The roads are too narrow for motor-cars (to pass).
家が狭い
The house is too small.
家が狭くて窮屈だ
We are pinched for room―cramped for room―confined for space.
この洋服は狭い
This is a tight coat―This suit is a tight fit.
胸の辺が狭い
It is too tight about the chest.
範囲が狭い
The range is limited.
彼は活動範囲が狭い
He has a limited sphere of activity―a small stage to play upon.
用語範囲が狭い
He has a limited vocabulary.
交際が狭い
He has a small circle of acquaintance.
日本のような狭い舞台では大きなことはできぬ
Japan is too small a country for a great undertaking.
土地が狭いから商売が発展せぬ
The place is too small for a large trade.
世間は広いようで狭い
The world is not so wide as it seems to be.
広い世間を狭くする
to lose credit with everybody
彼は心が狭い
He is narrow-minded―He is a man of narrow views.
そりゃ狭い了簡だ
That is a narrow view of life.
品物の販路が狭い
There is only a small market for the goods.
そう思うと肩身が狭いようだ
I feel small―I feel cheap―It is humiliating―to think so.
学校が盛んになって校舎が狭くなる
The school is growing too large for the building―outgrowing the building.
天低し地狭し
For him, the heavens are not high enough, the earth is not wide enough.
大道狭しと押し歩く
to stalk through the streets―lord it over the town

せまい〔施米〕
〈名〉Rice given in charity:(=する) to give rice, deal out rice (to the poor)

content:
せまくるしい〔狭苦しい〕
〈形〉(To be) pinched for room, cramped for room, confined for space; cramp, cramped (house)

content.content: 家が狭苦しい
We are pinched for room―cramped for room―confined for space―There is no room to turn in―There is no room to swing a cat―The house is cramp―cramped.
狭苦しい部屋に三人いる
We are three in a cramp room―in a cramped room.

content:
せまらず〔迫らず〕
〈自動〉To be calm; to be serene; to be composed; to be self-possessed

content.content: 彼は迫らないところがある
He is calm and composed.
態度従容として迫らず
He is composed―self-possessed.
彼の演説の態度は従容として迫らずというふうがある
He is serene on the platform.

content:
せまる〔迫る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=狭まる)to narrow; to become narrow; to become close

content.content: 両岸迫って水勢急なり
The banks become closer―The stream becomes narrower―and makes the current rapid.

content: 2. (=近づく、切迫する)to approach; to draw near; to be at hand; to be urgent; to be imminent; to impend; to press; to be on the eve of, on the brink of, on the verge of (some event)

content.content: 時期が迫る
The time approaches―draws near.
時が迫って来る
Time presses―We are pressed for time.
試験が迫って来た、目睫の間に迫った
The examination is close at hand―near at hand.
彼は死期に迫っている
He is dying―He is at death's door―He lies at the point of death.
運命旦夕に迫る
His days are numbered.
彼は滅亡に迫っている
He is on the drink of ruin―on the verge of ruin―on the eve of ruin.
滅亡眼前に迫る
Ruin stared me in the face―I was face to face with ruin.
死が眼前に迫った
Death stared me in the face―I stood face to face with death.
危険に迫る、危機に迫る
to be in imminent danger
彼は危険に迫っている
He is in imminent danger.
内閣の倒壊は焦眉に迫っている
The Cabinet is in imminent danger.
危険が目睫の間に迫っている
The danger is imminent.
危険が刻一刻と迫る
Danger impends―There is impending danger―There is imminent danger.
絵が真に迫っている
The painting is true to nature―true to the life.
肖像は真に迫っている
The portrait is drawn to the life―faithful to the original.

content: 3. (=極まる、窮する)to be pressed (by something); to be driven (by something)

content.content: 貧に迫る
to be pressed by poverty―poverty―stricken
彼らは貧苦に迫って始めて働く
They only work under the pressure of poverty―under stress of poverty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Poverty drives them to work―compels them to work.
貧苦に迫って盗みをした
He committed theft under the pressure of poverty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Poverty drove him to theft.
貧苦に迫って罪を犯す者が多い
Many people commit crimes under the pressure of poverty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Poverty drives many people to crime.
饑餓に迫る
to be pressed by hunger
人は飢餓に迫って働く
People work under the pressure of hunger―under the stimulus of hunger―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Hunger drives people to work―compels people to work.
人は飢渇に迫らなければ働かぬ
People will not work unless pressed by hunger―except under the pressure of hunger.
狼は饑餓に迫まると大胆になる
The wolf is driven by hunger to bolder measures.
饑餓に迫らなければ獅子は人にかからぬ
Unless driven by hunger to bolder measures, the lion will not willingly attack man.
必要に迫る
to be pressed by necessity
必要に迫って借りた金だ
The money was borrowed under the pressure of necessity―under stress of necessity―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Necessity obliged me to borrow the money―compelled me to borrow the money.
胸が迫る
My heart is full.
胸迫って言うあたわず
I could not speak in the fulness of my heart―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My heart was too full for words.
病人は呼吸が迫って来た
The invalid is breathing hard―hard of breathing―pressed for breath.

content: 4. (=押寄せる、詰め寄る)to press on (one); to press (one) hard; to press (one) close; to press for (something); to press (one to do something); to urge (one to do something); to work (one to do something); to make itself felt

content.content: 敵軍都に迫る
The enemy pressed on the capital―threatened the capital.
敵に迫る
to press the enemy hard―press the enemy close―close with the enemy―come to close quarters with the enemy―bear down upon the enemy
艨艟{もうどう}大海を圧して敵艦に迫る
The squadron, lording it over the deep bore down upon the enemy.
人に支払いを迫る
to press one for payment―push one for payment―urge one to pay a debt―dun one for a debt
先方では確答を迫っている
The other party presses for a definite answer.
ぜひいっしょにしてと母に迫った
He worked his mother to make her his wife.
生徒にひどく迫られて休みにしました
I was hard pressed by my students to close the school for the day.
涼気人に迫る
The cool makes itself felt.
鬼気人に迫る
A weird feeling makes itself felt.
饑餓身に迫る
Hunger began to make itself felt.
万感胸に迫る
A thousand emotions crowded on my mind―thronged on my mind.
せまらず〔迫らず〕

せみ〔滑車〕
〈名〉A pulley; a block

content:
せみ〔蝉〕
〈名〉The cicada; the cicada; the cigala

content.content: 蝉が鳴く
The cicada sings or chirps.
蝉の声
the cicada's song
蝉の殻
a cicada's shell
大木に蝉
a mite on an elephant

せみくじら〔背乾鯨〕
〈名〉The finback

せむし〔傴僂〕
〈名〉A humpback; a hunch-back:(=の) hump-backed; hunch-backed

content:
せめ〔責め〕
〈名〉
1. (=責任)responsibility; duty

content.content: 責めを負う
to bear the responsibility―assume the responsibility
その責めは僕が負う
I will answer for it―be responsible for it―hold myself responsible for it.
失敗したら僕がその責めを負う
I will answer for its failure.
失敗したら君にその責めを負わせる
You shall answer for its failure―I will hold you responsible for its failure.
本社はその責めに任せず
We do not hold ourselves responsible for it.
これを為す者はいかなる不幸に逢うも我れその責めに任せず
Those who do it must take the consequences.
責めを引く
to take the responsibility on oneself (and resign)
責めをふさぐ
to get through one's duty (in a perfunctory manner)
単に責めをふさいだまでだから賞むるに足らぬ
He only did his duty, and nothing more.

content: 2. (=非難、罪)blame; fault; charge

content.content: 責めを負う
to bear the blame
責めを負わせる
to lay the blame on one
彼に責めを負わせるのは可哀想だ
Do not lay the blame on the poor fellow!
責めは当局者に在り
The fault lies with the authorities―The authorities are to blame for it.
責めは自家に在り
The fault lies at your own door.
彼は怠慢の責めを免れぬ
He is open to the charge of negligence.

content: 3. (=責め苦)torture

content.content: 火責め水責め
torture by fire and water

content:
せめいる〔攻め入る〕
〈他動〉To invade (a country); to attack (a gate); to charge into (a castle)

content.content: 敵国に攻め入る
to invade the enemy's territory
搦手{からめて}から攻め入る
to attack the postern―(人にうまく取り入るの意味なら)―insinuate oneself into one's good graces

せめおとす〔攻め落とす〕
〈他動〉To take (a castle) by storm; to take (a fortress) by assault; to reduce (a fortress)

content:
せめく〔責苦〕
〈名〉Torture

content.content: 責め苦に逢う
to be subjected to torture―put to the torture―put to the rack
責め苦に逢わして白状させる
to torture one into confession
責め苦に堪える
to endure the torture
責め苦に堪えずして白状した
He was tortured into confession.

content:
せめぐ〔鬩ぐ〕
〈自動〉To quarrel

content.content: 兄弟墻に鬩ぐの時にあらず
This is no time for quarrelling among ourselves.
兄弟墻に鬩げども外悔りを受けず{けいていかきにせめげどもそとあなどりをうけず}
Party quarrels will cease in presence of national danger.

せめぐち〔攻め口〕
〈名〉Lines of approach; the approaches (to a fortress)

せめぐつわ〔責め銜〕
〈名〉A gag-bit

せめさいなむ〔責めさいなむ〕
〈他動〉To torture; to torment; to persecute

せめたづな〔責め手綱〕
〈名〉A gag-rein

content:
せめたてる〔攻め立てる〕
〈他動〉To throw oneself upon, fling oneself upon, hurl oneself upon (the enemy); to go at (one's work)

content.content: 無二無三に攻め立てる
to hurl oneself upon the enemy―(相手が個人なら)―make a dead set at a man―(相手が仕事なら)―go at it, tooth and nail

content:
せめて
〈副〉At least; at the very least; at all events; at most

content.content: 家は焼いてもせめて道具だけも出せば良かった
If the house could not be saved, you might, at least, have brought away the furniture.
せめていま一度会いたいものだ
I should like to see him, at least,once more.
せめて病気ででも死んだのなら諦めもつこうが
If he had died, at least, a natural death, I could reconcile myself to his loss.
せめて百円なら売るけれども
I would take 100 yen, at the very least.
せめて七十五円なら出すが
I would give 75 yen, at most.
おしょろ高島
Oshoro, Takashima lie
及びも無いが
Far, far, beyond my reach;
せめてうたすつ
Let me, at least, to Utasutsu go
磯谷まで
Or to Isoya's beach.

せめてものこころやり

content:
せめてものこころやり〔せめてもの心遣り〕
〈名〉One consolation

content.content: 故郷へ帰って死んだのがせめてもの心やりだ
He lived to see his native land, and that's one consolation.
けがの無かったのがせめてもである
It is one consolation to think that he has got off with a whole skin.

せめどうぐ〔攻め道具〕
〈名〉Weapons of attack

せめどうぐ〔責め道具〕
〈名〉Instruments of torture; the rack

せめとる〔攻め取る〕
〈他動〉To take (a castle) by storm; to take (a fortress) by assault; to reduce (a fortress)

せめほろぼす〔攻め亡ぼす〕
〈他動〉To conquer (the enemy)

content:
せめよせる〔攻め寄せる〕
〈自動〉To edge in

content.content: 敵を遠巻きしてだんだん攻め寄せた
We surrounded the enemy at a distance, and edged in closer and closer.

せめよる〔攻め寄る〕
〈他動〉To bear down upon (the enemy); to close in upon (a fortress)

content:
せめる〔攻める〕
〈他動〉To storm; to attack; to assault; to assail; to besiege

content.content: 城を攻める
to storm a castle―besiege a castle―lay siege to a castle
城を攻め取る
to take a castle by storm

content:
せめる〔責める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=非難する)to blame (one for a fault); to censure (one for a fault); to reproach (one with a fault); to upbraid (one with a fault)

content.content: 罪を責める
to blame one for a fault―reproach one with a fault
彼の怠慢の罪を責めた
I blamed him for negligence―reproached him with negligence.
女が男の浮気の罪を責めた
She reproached him with inconstancy.
世人は当局者の無責任を責める
People censure the authorities for their negligence.
己を責めて人を責めるな
Blame yourself and nor others.
君子は己を責むるに厳にして人を責むるに寛なり
The wise man is severe with himself and lenient with others.
可哀そうにあの男を責めるな
Do not lay the blame on the poor fellow!
責むべき人を責める
to lay the blame on the right shoulder―put the saddle on the right horse

content: 2. (=責め苦に逢わす)to torture; to subject (one) to torture; to put (one) to the torture; to put (one) to the rack

content.content: 人を責めて白状させる
to torture one into confession
彼は責められてとうとう白状した
He was finally tortured into confession.
心の鬼が身を責める
My conscience pricks me―I feel the pangs of conscience.
債鬼に責められる
to be dunned for a debt

content: 3. (=せびる)to tease, importune (one for anything)

content.content: この子はお母さんを責めて何でも欲しい物を買って貰う
The boy will tease his mamma out of anything he wants.
彼は友人を責めて金を借りて歩く
He will importune his friends for loans.

content:
セメント
〈名〉Cement

content.content: セメントで接ぐ
to cement stones or bricks

content:
せもつ〔施物〕
〈名〉Alms; charity

content.content: 施物をする
to give alms―give in charity

content:
せやく〔施薬〕
〈名〉Gratuitous dispensation of medicine:(=する) to dispense medicine gratis; to dispense medicine free

content.content: 貧民に限り施薬す
Medicine (is) dispensed free to the poor.
施薬所
a (charity) dispensary

content:
せよ
〈接続詞〉Though; whether; whoever; whatever; whichever; whenever; wherever; however; no matter (who, what, etc.)

content.content: 大臣にせよ(何にせよ)そんなことをする権利は無い
Though he may be a minister,―Minister or no minister,―he has no right to do such a thing.
真偽はいずれにもせよその説は我々には関係の無いことだ
The statement, whether it may be true or false,―be it true or false,―does not concern us.
成功失敗いずれにもせよこの金は要る
Whether I may succeed or fail, I shall need the money―I shall need the money in either case.
そう言う人は誰にせよ間違っている
Whoever may say so,―No matter who may say,―Say so who will,―he is wrong.
何事にせよ粗末にするな
Whatever the matter may be,―Be the matter what it may,―do your best.
人はどれほど金持ちにせよ徒食するものでない
However rich a man may be,―No matter how rich a man may be―Be man as rich as he will,―Be a man ever so rich,―he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.

せよ〔施与〕
〈名〉Charity:(=する) to give in charity

content:
せり〔競り〕
〈名〉Auction

content.content: 競りで売る
to sell anything by auction
競りで買う
to buy anything at an auction
競りに出す
to put up an article for auction
競りにかける
to bring anything under the hammer―put anything to the hammer
家が競りにかかった
The house came under the hammer―went to the hammer.

せりあい〔競り合い〕
〈名〉Competition:(=する) to compete with (each other); to bid against (each other); to outbid (each other)

せりあう〔競り合う〕
〈自動〉To compete with (each other); to bid against (each other); to outbid (each other)

content:
せりあげる〔競り上げる〕
〈他動〉To bid up (the price)

content.content: 百円まで競り上げた
They bid up the price to 100 yen.

content:
せりうり〔競り売り〕
〈名〉Sale by auction:(=する) to sell (anything) by auction

content.content: 競り売りでこの箪笥を買った
I bought this cabinet at an auction.
競り売り人
an auctioneer
競り売り場
an auction-room

せりおとす〔競り落とす〕
〈他動〉To knock down (an article)

せりだす〔迫り出す〕
〈他動〉(=押し出す)to push out
〈自動〉(=芝居の奈落から出る)to rise (at the trap-door)

〈名〉(The actor's) speech, words

content:
せりょう〔施療〕
〈名〉Free medical treatment; gratuitous treatment:(=する) to treat (one) free of charge; to treat (one) gratis; to treat (one) gratuitously; to treat (one) for nothing; to give (one) a free treatment

content.content: 施療院
a free hospital―a charity hospital
施療患者
a free patient―a charity patient

content:
セル
〈名〉Serge

content.content: セルの洋服
a serge suit

content:
せる〔競る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=競う)to compete (with one)
2. (=競り売りする) to sell by auction
3. (=競り売りで値を付ける) to bid (for an article); to make a bid

content.content: 十円まで競ってみたが落ちなかった
I bid ten yen for the article, but it was not knocked down.
競り合う
to bid against each other―outbid each other
競り上げる
to bid up the price
百円まで競り上げた
They bid up the price to 100 yen.
競りおとす
to knock down the article
競り手
a bidder

content:
せろ〔世路〕
〈名〉The path of life

content.content: 世路の難儀
the thorny path of life

content:
せろん〔世論〕
〈名〉Public opinion

content.content: 世論がやかましい
It is the talk of the town.

content:
せわ〔世話〕
〈名〉
1. (=助力)help; aid; assistance:(=する) to help; to aid; to assist

content.content: できることならお前を世話してやりたいが
I would help you if I could.
伯(叔)父が世話してくれると申します
My uncle offers to help me.
あの男の世話をして迷惑した者が一人や二人じゃない
Several people have got into trouble through helping that man.
あれは義理一遍で世話をしているのだ
I help him as a matter of duty.
世話になる
to receive help―receive assistance
あなたのお世話になろうと思って参りました
I have been looking to you for assistance.
あの男は世話し甲斐があった
I have not assisted him for nothing.

content: 2. (=周旋)good offices; kind offices:(=する) to procure, secure (one a position); to get (one a berth); to find (one a person)

content.content: 好い口があったらお世話を願います
I shall request your good offices when there is a good opening.
友人の世話で会社へ入りました
I have entered the company's service through a friend―through the good offices of a friend.
あの人の世話で相談がまとまった
The matter was settled through his kind offices.
田中君の世話で今の地位を得ました
I have secured my position through Mr. Tanaka―Mr. Tanaka has secured me my present position―procured me my present position.
どこか好いところへお世話しよう
I will procure you some good position―find you some good position―get you a good berth―(嫁入口の意味なら)―find a good husband for you.
しかるべき地位があったらお世話下さい
If you come across a suitable position, you will please procure it for me.
女中を一人世話してくれんか
Will you find me a maid-servant?
それより奥さんをお世話しよう
I would rather find you a wife.

content: 3. (=扱い)care; charge:(=する) to care for (one's children); to take care of (a child); to take charge of (an orphan); to look after (the children); to mind (the children); to tend (the shop); to attend to (the sick); to look to (one's comfort); to minister to (one's wants); to see to, see about (a matter)

content.content: 子どもの世話をする
(親なら)to care for one's children―(他人なら)―take care of the children―look after the children―mind the children
あの子は(孤児で)世話のし手が無い
She has no one to care for her.
子どもの世話をする女が欲しい
I want a female to take care of the children.
あれは子どもの世話をしている女です
She is the female in charge of the children.
孤児はある慈善家が引取って世話をした
A benevolent person took charge of the orphan.
孤児は自活のできるようになるまで俺が世話をしてやろう
I will take charge of him till he can shift for himself.
子どもの世話が行き届いている
The children are well cared for.
子どもの世話をする者が無い(から継子扱いだ)
The children are left to take care of themselves.
病院の世話をする
to care for the invalid―attend to the sick―look to one's comfort―minister to one's wants
病院の世話を頼む
Please see the sick well cared for!
親身も及ばぬ世話ぶり
She cared for him better than his own people could have done.
生徒の世話をする
to have the care of students
この生徒らはだれが世話をしているか
Who has the care of these students?―Under whose care are these students?
僕が世話をしている生徒にもこの本を使っている
I use this book with the students under my care.
あの生徒らは五年間世話をして来た
I have had the care of those students―had those students under my care―for five years.
先生、宅の小僧のお世話をお願い申します
I wish to place my boy under your care.
宿屋の女中がお客の世話をする
The chambermaid attends to the guests.
あの女中が下宿人の世話をする
She does for the lodgers.
牛の世話をする男が要る
We want a man to look after the cows―to tend the cows.
あれが牛の世話をする男だ
He is the man in charge of the cows.
店の世話をする
to take care of the shop―attend to the shop―tend the shop―mind the ship
今晩はここに泊まるからふとんの世話を頼む
I shall stay here for the night, so please look to my bedding―see to my bedding―see about my bedding.
篤く世話をする
to take good care of one
あの男は世話し甲斐があった
He has well repaid my care.

content: 4. (=親切)goodness; (a) kindness; a favour; a service; a good turn; a debt; attentions; obligations; interest:(=する) to be good to (one); to be kind to (one); to be friendly to (one); to show (one) kindness; to do (one) a kindness; to do (one) a favour; to do (one) a service; to do (one) a good turn; to pay (one) attentions; to lay (one) under obligations; to take interest in (one)

content.content: あの方にはお世話になりました

He has been good to me―kind to me―He has done me a kindness―done me a favour―done me a service―done me a good turn―laid me under obligations―I lie under obligations to him―I owe him a debt of gratitude.
いろいろお世話になりました
He has done me many kindnesses―I lie under obligations to him.
お世話になっているから何を頼まれても否と言えぬ
I lie under such obligations to him that I can refuse him nothing.
このたびはお世話さまでした
Thank you for your kindness!―I am obliged to you―You have laid me under an obligation.
あの婦人には病気中世話になった
She was good to me in my illness.
病気中は一方ならぬお世話になりました
I thank you for your exceeding goodness to me in my illness.
あの人は人の世話になることが嫌いだ
He does not like to lie under obligations.
君のお世話にゃならぬ
I ask no favour of you―(を略して)―I ask nothing of you.
あの先生は書生の世話が好きだ
He takes interest in students.
よく後進の世話をする
He takes a kindly interest in his juniors.
我が子のように僕を世話してくれる
He takes a fatherly interest in me―He was a second father to me.
女将がやれそれと世話をしてくれた
The landlady paid me great attentions.
ただならぬ世話ぶりであった
She was assiduous in her attentions.
彼は死んだ兄の子をよく世話する
He does well by his brother's children.
近所の人達がいろいろ世話をしてくれます
My neighbours are very friendly to me.
お世話になりついでにまたお世話になりましょう
As I owe you a debt, I may as well increase my debt.
世話になった人
one's patron―one's benefactor
世話になった人には頭が上がらぬ
One must be humble before one's benefactor.

content: 5. (=厄介)dependence

content.content: 親の世話になる
to depend on one's father
まだ親の世話になっているか(親の脛を噛っているか)
Are you still dependent on your father?
子が親の世話になるのは当たり前だ
It is quite natural that a child should depend on his parents.
できるなら親の世話になりたくない
I do not wish to be a burden to my father if I can help it.
親父が死んでから伯(叔)父の世話になっております
I have lived with my uncle since my father died.

content: 6. (=干渉)meddling

content.content: 世話を焼く
to meddle―(は悪い意味、善い意味には)―make oneself useful
彼は店の世話を焼いている
He makes himself useful in the shop.
万事に世話を焼いている
He makes himself generally useful.
出発の際にはいろいろ世話を焼いてくれた
He made himself useful to me in various ways at my departure.
彼はなんでもかでも世話を焼きたがる
He meddles in everything―pokes his nose into everything―has a finger in every pie.
人のことに余計な世話を(要らぬ世話)を焼く
to meddle in others' affairs
お世話を焼いて貰いますまい
No meddling in my affairs, please!―I will thank you to leave my affairs alone.
大きなお世話だ
Mind your own business!―That's none of your business.
あれはお世話焼きで困る
He is a meddler―a busybody.

content: 7. (=面倒)trouble

content.content: 世話を焼かせる
to give one trouble
あの女はずいぶん世話を焼かせやがった
She has caused me much trouble―led me a pretty dance.
お前は世話の焼ける子だね
You are a troublesome child.
子どもらは世話が焼ききれない
The children give me a lot of trouble.
今は教員を養成する世話が無い
You need not go to the trouble of―need not be at the trouble of―training teachers.
ここに住めば車を抱える世話が無い
If I live here, I need not go to the trouble and expense of keeping a kuruma.
あれまでに育て上げればもう世話はありません
Now that he is quite grown up, there is no more trouble for you.
食ってしまえば世話は無いや
If you eat them up, there is no trouble―that's the easiest way.
取る金を片っ端から使ってしまえば世話は無い
If you spend as you earn, that's the simplest plan.
自分でそう思っていりゃ世話は無いや
If you think so yourself, that is the best way.

content: 8. (=人の扶助を受けること)bounty

content.content: 友人達の世話になるのはいやだ
I don't like to subsist on the bounty of my friends.

content: 9. (=人を泊めること)hospitality

content.content: 人の家に世話になる
to impose upon one's hospitality
それではお世話になりましょうか
Then I shall accept your hospitality.
人の家に世話になるのは心苦しい
It goes against my conscience to impose upon people's hospitality.
この上お世話になっては済まないから
I shall be sorry to impose upon your hospitality any more.
長く世話になった礼を言った
I thanked him for his long hospitality.

content: 10. (=妾を抱えること)keeping (a mistress)

content.content: そのお方が私を世話して下さると仰有いました
He offered to keep me as mistress.
あの女優は成金の世話になっているのだ
She is kept by an upstart.
お前は誰かの世話になっているのか
Are you kept by anybody?―Are you anybody's mistress?
誰の世話になっているのか
Who is your patron?

content: 11. (=世俗)the common world

content.content: 世話に砕ける
to use a common expression―use familiar language
世話に砕けていえば
To use a common expression―in common parlance.

せわげき〔世話劇〕
〈名〉A domestic drama

content:
せわしい〔忙しい〕
〈形〉Busy

content.content: 僕はずいぶんせわしい身だ
I am very busy―I have not a minute that I can call my own.
目がまわるほどせわしい
I live in a whirl of business.
今日は一日雑務でせわしかった
I have been busied with―occupied with―the avocations of my business all day.
せわしく暮らす
to lead a busy life―live a stirring life
子どもらがせわしく茶やタバコ盆をだした
The children offered him tea and tobacco-tray with busy zeal.

content:
せわしない〔忙しない〕
〈形〉Restless; fidgety

content.content: せわしない人だねー
What a restless man you are!
彼はせわしない人でちょっともじっとしておらぬ
He is always in a fidget.

せわずき〔世話好き〕
〈形〉(好く言えば) officious:(悪く言えば)meddlesome

content:
せわなし〔世話無し〕
〈形〉No trouble; easy; simple

content.content: 食べてしまえば世話無しだ
If you eat them up, there is no trouble―that's the easiest way.
取る金を片っ端から使ってしまえば世話無しだ
If you spend as you earn, that is the simplest plan.
自分でそう思っていりゃ世話無しだ
If you think so yourself, that's the best way.
こんなことは世話無しだ
Nothing can be simpler.

content:
せわにょうぼう〔世話女房〕
〈名〉A good housewife; a notable woman

content.content: 細君は世帯の苦労ばかりしている世話女房だ
His wife is a notable woman with all household cares upon her shoulders.

せわにん〔世話人〕
〈名〉A manager

せわば〔世話場〕
〈名〉(=芝居の世話場)A domestic scene

content:
せわぶり〔世話振り〕
〈名〉Attentions

content.content: 女将はやれそれとたいそう世話ぶりをみせた
The landlady paid me great attentions―She paid him sedulous attentions.
ただならぬ世話振りであった、下へも置かぬ世話ぶり
She was assiduous in her attentions.
ただならぬ世話ぶりだと思った
I perceived her assiduities.
親身も及ばぬ世話ぶり
She cared for him better than his own people could have done.

せわもの〔世話物〕
〈名〉(=芝居の世話物)A domestic play

content:
せわやき〔世話焼き〕
〈名〉
1. (=世話役)a manager
2. (=お世話焼き)a meddler; a busybody; an officious person:(=な) meddlesome; officious

content.content: 君はずいぶんお世話焼きだね
How meddlesome you are!―You are a hen with one chicken.
お世話焼きはまっぴら
“Save me from my friends!”

せわやく〔世話役〕
〈名〉A manager

content.content: せんにん〔仙人〕

content:
』
2. ［米貨］A cent

せん〔先〕
〈形〉Former:(=に)formerly; before

content.content: 先の校長
the former principal
あの人には先に逢ったことがある
I have met him before.
先にはこうでなかった
It was formerly not so.

content: 〈名〉The first

content:

〈名〉A senior; an elder:(集合的に言えば)one's elders; one's superiors

content.content: 彼は僕の先輩だ
He is my senior.
先輩を尊敬すべし
You should respect your elders.
先輩達のお引立てによって今の地位を得ました
I have risen through the patronage of my elders.
先輩ぶる
to assume a superior air
彼は君に向かって先輩ぶるか
Does he come the senior over you?

content.content: 戦敗国
a vanquished power

a vanquished people

content:

〈名〉Total abolition:(=する) to abolish totally

content.content: 公娼全廃すべし
Licensed prostitution should be totally abolished.

ぜんぱい〔全敗〕
〈名〉A complete defeat; a total defeat:(=する) to be totally defeated; to sustain a complete defeat

〈名〉A patent

to take a patent―take out a patent―obtain a patent―secure a patent―have an article patented

to apply for a patent

A patent has been applied for.

an applicant for a patent
専売特許を許す
to grant a patent
新案が専売特許になる
A new design is patented.

a patented article

a patentee
専売特許状

a patent agent
専売特許申請代理業
patent agency
専売特許弁護士
a patent solicitor
専売特許料
patent fee
専売特許法
the patent law
専売特許権
patent rights
専売特許権を侵害する

専売特許侵害
infringement on a patent
専売特許侵害品
an infringement on a patent

the Patent Bureau
専売特許局長
the director of the Patent Bureau―the Master of the Rolls
専売特許局審査官
a Judge of the Patent Bureau
専売特許品陳列場
a Patent Museum
専売特許公報
the Patent Journal
専売特許原簿
a patent-ledger
専売特許登録簿

content:
せんぱく〔浅薄〕
〈形〉Shallow (learning); superficial (knowledge); frivolous (reason); flimsy (pretext, etc.)

content.content: 浅薄な知識
superficial knowledge
彼の学問は浅薄だ
His learning is shallow―He is a sciolist.
それは浅薄な議論だ
That is a shallow argument.
彼は浅薄な口実をもって断った
He refused on a flimsy pretext.
あれは浅薄な人間だ
He is a shallow-brain.

content:

〈名〉Ships; shipping; marine:(=の) marine; shipping

content.content: 港には船舶が輻湊している
The harbour is crowded with shipping.
暴風雨が船舶を害した
The storm has done damage to the shipping.
商業船舶
the mercantile marine
船舶所有者
a shipowner
船舶中立人
a ship-broker
船舶管理人
a ship's husband
船舶の出入
the movement of shipping―the entry clearance of ships
船舶入港
a ship's entry
船舶入港届
a notice of entry
船舶出港
a ship's clearance
船舶出港免状
a clearance permit
船舶法
the shipping law
船舶書類
the ship's papers
船舶用品
ship's stores
船舶登記簿
the shipping register
船舶国籍証書
the certificate of a ship's nationality
船舶臨検
visitation of ships
船舶課
the Marine Section
船舶司検所
the Office of Marine Inspection and Survey

content:
せんばつ〔選抜〕
〈名〉Choice; selection:(=する) to choose (from among many―one or two out of many); to select, single out, pick out (the best)

content.content: 彼は大勢の中から選抜された
He was chosen from among many.
彼は選抜されて外国へ留学を命ぜられた
He was selected for study abroad.
留学生の選抜に漏れた
He was left out of the selection of students ordered abroad for study.
選抜生
picked students
選抜隊
a party of picked men
選抜試験
a selective examination

content:
せんぱつ〔先発〕
〈名〉Starting in advance:(=する) to start in advance

content.content: この隊は本隊より先発した
The party started in advance of the main body.
先発隊
an advance party
先発隊を送った
We sent a party in advance.
(競争の)先発権
start
十間の先発を許す
I will give you twenty yards start.
十五秒の先発を許す
I will give you fifteen seconds start.

content:
せんばん〔千万〕
〈副〉A thousand times; exceedingly; extremely; very much

content.content: 千万かたじけない
A thousand thanks!
彼が居ないのは遺憾千万だ
It is a thousand pities that he should not be here.
失敬千万だ
What impertinence!
不都合千万だ
It is outrageous―atrocious.

content:

content.content: 踏旋盤
a foot lathe

旋盤工
a turner

a turnery

〈名〉The whole:(=の) whole; general; universal

content.content: 英語の全般に亙って研究する
to range over the length and breadth of―make an exhaustive study of―the English language
この思想は社会の全般に行き渡っている
The idea pervades all classes of society.
全般の形勢を窺う
to observe the general situation

〈名〉The stern:(=に) aft:(=へ) astern

content.content: 船尾材
the stern-post
船尾砲
a stern-chaser
船首と船尾に大砲がある
There is gun fore and aft.
船尾楼
the poop
船尾回廊
the stern-walk
船尾突出部
the counter
船尾に当たって船あり
There is a sail astern of us.

せんび〔鮮美〕
〈形〉Fresh, vivid (colour, etc.)

content:
せんぴ〔先非〕
〈名〉A past error

content.content: 彼は先非を悔いている
He repents of the past.
先非の罪滅しをする
to atone for the past

content:
ぜんび〔善美〕
〈名〉The good and the beautiful

content.content: 普請は善美を尽している
The building is sumptuous.

content:
ぜんび〔全備〕
〈名〉Completeness; perfection; consummation:(=する) to complete; to perfect; to consummate; to equip fully, furnish completely, fit up with all necessary appliances

content.content: 病院の設備が全備している
The hospital is fully equipped with the necessary appliances.
全備した家だ
The house is completely furnished―well appointed.
図書館は全備している
The library is well stocked. (with books―の意味)
工場は全備している
The factory is fitted up with all the necessary appliances.
全備した工場だ
It is a perfectly equipped factory.

content:
ぜんぴ〔前非〕
〈名〉One's past error; one's past folly

content.content: 前非を悔いる
to repent of one's past
前非を悟りました
I have come to a sense of my past error―come to my senses.
前非を悟って改めた
I was convinced of my error, and resolved on amendment―A sense of my past folly made me resolve on amendment.
前非の罪滅しをする
to atone for one's past―unlive the past

content:
ぜんぴょう〔全豹〕
〈名〉The whole; the general state or condition

content.content: 一斑を見て全豹を知る
to infer the whole from a part
この一斑を見れば全豹を知るを得べし
This instance shows all the rest.
一斑を見て全豹を断ずべからず
You must not infer the whole from a part.
これを見れば彼らの生活の全豹を窺い知るに足る
This will give you a glance into their general life.
